intro: Hieracium kaerkoeense, commonly known as the Karaköy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and basal leaves that are often heart-shaped. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow-orange inflorescences that attract pollinators.
